log.input:
Simple Pendulum

If we define the moment of inertia (I) as:

$$
I = mr^2
$$

Since the torque $\tau$ and angular acceleration $\alpha$ are in opposite directions, their relationship is given by:

$$
\tau = -I\alpha \Rightarrow rF\sin\theta = -mr^2 \frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2} \Rightarrow \frac{F}{m}r\sin\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

If $r = L$ and $F = mg$, and when $\theta < 5^\circ$, $\sin \theta \approx \theta$, then the equation can be rewritten as:

$$
\frac{g}{L}\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

From this, we can derive:

$$
\theta(t) = \theta_0 \cos\left(\sqrt{\frac{g}{L}} t\right) = \theta_0 \cos(\omega t)
$$

In the above formula, $\omega$ is the angular frequency of the oscillation, thus the period is:

$$
T = \frac{2\pi}{\omega} = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}
$$

Program to be written:

An ideal simple pendulum that calculates the motion process and period by changing the initial swing angle.

The pendulum should swing back and forth naturally, starting from an initial angle and oscillating under the influence of gravity. The motion should follow the simple harmonic motion equation and not complete a full circle.

(1) Define and initialize a variable named Length_I as a cyber input variable, set Length_I=10
(2) Define and initialize a variable named Radius_I as a cyber input variable, set Radius_I=1
(3) Length_I is the length of the pendulum. When Length_I changes to a new value, the length of the pendulum also changes to that value.
(4) Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.
(5) Do not import packages that are not supported by VPython such as numpy, math and time
log.output:
from vpython import *

# (1) & (2)
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Create pendulum and ceiling
ceiling = box(pos=vector(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.white)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I,0,0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.yellow)

# Create rod
rod = cylinder(pos=vector(0,0,0), axis=ball.pos, radius=0.01, color=color.white)

# Initialize parameters
ball.mass = 1
ball.v = vector(0,0,0)
theta = -1
g = 9.8

# Time parameters
t = 0
dt = 0.01

while True:
    rate(100)

    # (3) & (4)
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*cos(theta),Length_I*sin(theta),0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos

    # Calculate acceleration
    alpha = -(g/Length_I)*sin(theta)

    # Update velocity and theta
    ball.v.y = ball.v.y + alpha*dt
    theta = theta + ball.v.y*dt

    # Update time
    t = t + dt

log.output:
from vpython import *
import math

# (1) & (2)
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1
Theta_Max = math.radians(10) # maximum swing angle

# Create pendulum and ceiling
ceiling = box(pos=vector(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.white)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0,-Length_I,0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.yellow) # start from vertically downward position

# Create rod
rod = cylinder(pos=vector(0,0,0), axis=ball.pos, radius=0.01, color=color.white)

# Initialize parameters
ball.mass = 1
g = 9.8

# Time parameters
t = 0
dt = 0.01

theta = 0
omega = 0

while True:
    rate(100)

    # Calculate acceleration
    alpha = -(g/Length_I)*sin(theta)

    # Update velocity and theta
    omega = omega + alpha*dt
    theta = theta + omega*dt

    # Oscillate within 10 degrees
    if theta > Theta_Max:
        theta = Theta_Max
        omega = -omega
    elif theta < -Theta_Max:
        theta = -Theta_Max
        omega = -omega

    # Update ball position and rod axis
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos

    # Update time
    t = t + dt

Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

ceiling = box(pos=vector(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.white)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(0,-Length_I,0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.yellow)

rod = cylinder(pos=vector(0,0,0), axis=ball.pos, radius=0.01, color=color.white)

theta = 0

    omega = omega + alpha*dt
    theta = theta + omega*dt

    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos - rod.pos

    t = t + dt

ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I,0,0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.yellow)
rod = cylinder(pos=vector(0,0,0), axis=ball.pos, radius=0.01, color=color.white)

ball.mass = 1
ball.v = vector(0,0,0)
theta = -1
g = 9.8

t = 0
dt = 0.01

while True:
    rate(100)
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*cos(theta),Length_I*sin(theta),0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos
    alpha = -(g/Length_I)*sin(theta)
    ball.v.y = ball.v.y + alpha*dt
    theta = theta + ball.v.y*dt
    t = t + dt

from vpython import *
from math import sin, cos

Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

ceiling = box(pos=vector(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.white)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I,0,0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.yellow)

rod = cylinder(pos=vector(0,0,0), axis=ball.pos, radius=0.01, color=color.white)

ball.mass = 1
g = 9.8

t = 0
dt = 0.01

theta = -1

while True:
    rate(100)

    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*cos(theta),-Length_I*sin(theta),0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos

    alpha = -(g/Length_I)*sin(theta)

    theta = theta + alpha*dt

    t = t + dt
